thread.title: Doncaster man s throat slashed, Victoria Police release CCTV - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Doncaster man s throat slashed, Victoria Police release CCTV - Yahoo7

author: Mel Buttigieg
title: Doncaster man s throat slashed, Victoria Police release CCTV - Yahoo7
text:
Share Doncaster man s throat slashed, Victoria Police release CCTV - Yahoo7 CCTV released today shows how a man visited a Melbourne murder scene 24 hours before the victim was found with his throat slashed, then returned the next day, around the time of the attack, according to police. Close CCTV released as police investigate Doncaster car park death UP NEXT VIDEO CCTV released as police investigate Doncaster car park death. Source: Victoria Police CCTV released as police investigate Doncaster car park death 
Victoria Police have released the footage as they seek public assistance to identify a man believed to be linked to last Friday morning's murder at Doncaster. 
Thirty-six year-old Doncaster man David Dick has been identified as the victim found at a Westfield lift lobby "brutally attacked", police said. Police are seeking public assistance to identify a man believed to be linked to the murder of a Doncaster man on Friday. Pictures: Victoria Police 
A witness said the man's throat was slashed, but police have only confirmed the man suffered "serious head injuries". 
Members of a fitness group found the man and tried to resuscitate him, but he was unable to be revived and died at the scene soon after. 
Detectives have obtained CCTV footage of the shopping centre from 24 hours before the suspected attack, which shows a man in the same location as where Mr Dick was found on Friday. 
Investigators believe the footage indicates the suspect is likely to have targeted Mr Dick, police said in a statement. 
"At this stage there is no known motive for the vicious attack, with David struck without warning as he exited the lift," the statement said. 
The offender fled down a fire exit before heading south from the car park in the direction of Doncaster Road. David Dick, 36, was found with serious injuries at a Doncaster shopping centre lift lobby early Friday morning and died soon after. Picture: Victoria Police The killer has not yet been apprehended. Picture: 7 News 
Investigators believe the offender is likely to have injured his hand during the attack and may have sought medical treatment. 
Police are appealing for anyone who recognises the man to come forward. 
The man is described as being perceived to be of Caucasian appearance, aged in his 30s, about 176cm tall with a solid build and mousy brown hair. Close Hunt for a killer after body found at Doncaster shopping centre UP NEXT VIDEO Hunt for a killer after body found at Doncaster shopping centre. Source: Seven News Hunt for a killer after body found at Doncaster shopping centre 
Footage from Thursday shows him wearing a grey, hooded jumper, tracksuit pants and runners, and he was carrying an item with a long yellow cover. 
The man of interest is believed to have been near the car parks at the shopping centre between 5.45am and 6.10am on Thursday, and again during the same time the following day, around the time Mr Dick was found. 
Detectives have also released an image of Mr Dick in the hope someone can provide further information on his movements in the days before his death. The Westfield Doncaster car park was closed on Friday as homicide squad and forensic investigators searched the scene. Source: 7 News 
Detective Inspector Michael Hughes said "there was someone out there" who knew what had happened to Mr Dick. 
“This was an incredibly brutal attack and David’s family is devastated by his death,” he said. 
“We’re keen to speak to anyone who recognises the man shown in the footage, and has information about his movements in the lead-up to the fatal attack.” 
Anyone with information is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers 1800 333 000 or use the Crime Stoppers online reporting page .
